formattedAddress: 116 E 63rd St #1A, New York, NY 10065, USA
adrFormatAddress: 116 E 63rd St #1A, New York, NY 10065, USA

originalText.text:
Excellent Doctor, professional, caring, knowledgeable, treating his patients as he would treat his family, been working with Dr. Zbarsky for many years, since 2001 and have many mutual patients, always available to discuss particular patient problems with attention to details and best outcome.
Best Doctor in NYC!!!

Excellent Doctor, professional, caring, knowledgeable, treating his patients as he would treat his family, been working with Dr. Zbarsky for many years, since 2001 and have many mutual patients, always available to discuss particular patient problems with attention to details and best outcome.
Best Doctor in NYC!!!

originalText.text:
I have been a patient of Dr. Zbarsky for MANY years. I scheduled an appointment for a well overdue physical and was told that although they don’t take my insurance from new patients, they’ll take it from me because I am a long existing patient. Unfortunately my grandmother passed away and I had to reschedule my initial appointment, but finally made it in. Again,the office called me the day before to confirm my appointment, never once mentioning that they won’t honor my insurance. After coming in to the office, they told me they actually WON’T accept my insurance, even though I’ve been a patient for many years. They said if I had an appointment earlier, they would’ve taken it. Remember, I did have an appointment earlier,  but had to reschedule due to the death of my grandmother.

I am so disappointed. I understand doctors can select to accept the insurance they want- but they specifically told me they’d take it from me. I wouldn’t have lost a personal day otherwise and wouldn’t have made this appointment.

Besides this, I’m a healthy 35 year old female with zero heart disease in my family and for years, every time I went in for a physical, they did an EKG. I was naive and thought that was normal, until I spoke to friends in the medical field. Turns out this office likes to run all kinds of unnecessary tests in order to charge insurance.
Kept that in for a long time because I wanted to give them benefit of the doubt. But not being silent about it now because clearly, they have zero regard for patients- we’re all $$ signs to them.

originalText.text: Great Doctor, Dr Vadim Zbarsky, great office, patient friendly, superior service in patient assistance, specially the office administration, Sukhina Tatyana, who is always there for the patients and go behind that can be done to help patients of their needs and always there for them.  Great job from her. I would like to thank her and doctor for the job they do to serve our community, specially at the time of Covid-19, Tatyana was always there in assisting patients, in fast manner, in all aspects of their needs. Thumbs up!

originalText.text: I'd only recommend him for basic issues such as ear infection etc as he'll refer you to a specialist for the rest. Perfect for the elderly as paperwork is done by hand-no computers in sight.

originalText.text: This office gave me additional charges and the doctor informed me that they are covered within my insurance. It is very irresponsible of them to misinform their patients and I do not recommend going to this office.
